item.title: 消息人士称，Skydance Media 获得派拉蒙控制权的交易可能在本周末完成
item.description: 熟悉交易过程的消息人士称，Skydance Media 收购影院运营商 National Amusements 及其在派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）的控股权的交易可能在下周一敲定。【原文：Skydance Media's deal to acquire theater operator National Amusements, with its controlling interest in Paramount Global , could be finalized by Monday, sources familiar with the deal process said.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，KKR 将以 47.5 亿美元从贝恩资本手中收购 Varsity Brands
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周三表示，私募股权公司 KKR & Co 同意以约 47.5 亿美元（包括债务）的价格从收购公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）手中收购美国运动服和学校年鉴制造商 Varsity Brands。【原文：Private equity firm KKR & Co agreed to acquire Varsity Brands, a U.S. maker of sports uniforms and school yearbooks, from buyout firm Bain Capital for about $4.75 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国银行商业地产贷款最新暴跌后忧虑犹存
item.description: 美国一些地区性银行和中型银行继续面临商业房地产（CRE）行业高风险带来的挤压。【原文：Several U.S. regional and mid-sized banks continue to face the squeeze from high exposure to the commercial real estate (CRE) sector that has been roiled by higher-for-longer interest rates and empty office buildings.】

item.title: 微软以 1400 万美元就加州有关工人休假的调查达成和解
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp）周三表示，该公司已同意支付 1400 万美元，以了结加州一家机构关于该公司非法惩罚请病假或家庭护理假的员工的指控。【原文：Microsoft Corp has agreed to pay $14 million to settle a California agency's claims that it illegally penalized workers who took medical or family-care leave, the agency said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉反对派在美国法院就 Citgo 支持的债券争端中获得支持
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周三撤销了一名法官的裁决，即债券持有人对委内瑞拉国营石油公司提出的与该公司在美国的炼油厂 Citgo 有关的有效索赔，并指示法官在评估索赔时适用委内瑞拉法律。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Wednesday set aside a judge's ruling that bondholders had valid claims against Venezuela's state-run oil company related to its U.S. refiner Citgo, and directed the judge to apply Venezuela law in assessing the claims.】

item.title: 道富取代瑞银成为瑞士政府基金托管银行
item.description: 瑞士当局周三表示，美国道富银行已获得授权，担任瑞士联邦政府数十亿美元补偿基金的托管银行，该基金之前由瑞银集团托管。【原文：U.S. bank State Street has won a mandate to act as custodian bank for a multibillion-dollar compensation fund of the Swiss federal government that was previously at UBS , authorities said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商回应欧盟对中国产电动汽车征收关税
item.description: 欧盟对中国产电动汽车征收额外关税的措施预计将于本周四生效，一些汽车制造商已决定采取反制措施。【原文：With the European Union's extra duties on Chinese-made electric vehicles expected to take effect on Thursday, some carmakers have decided on counter measures.】

item.title: 扎克伯格称，Meta's Threads 的月活跃用户数已超过 1.75 亿
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司首席执行官马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）周三透露，Meta Platforms 最新推出的社交媒体 Threads 月活跃用户已超过 1.75 亿。【原文：Meta Platforms' newest social media offering, Threads, has over 175 million monthly active users, CEO Mark Zuckerberg revealed on Wednesday, two days ahead of its first anniversary.】

item.title: 股价创历史新高后，杰夫-贝索斯将出售价值约 50 亿美元的亚马逊股票
item.description: 一份监管文件显示，亚马逊创始人兼执行董事长杰夫-贝索斯正计划出售这家电子商务巨头价值近 50 亿美元的股票，此前该公司股价创下历史新高。【原文：Amazon founder and executive chair Jeff Bezos is planning to sell almost $5 billion worth of shares in the e-commerce giant, a regulatory filing showed, after its stock hit a record high.】

item.title: 全球监管机构表示，银行将从 2026 年 1 月起公布加密资产风险敞口
item.description: 全球银行监管机构周三表示，已经批准了银行从 2026 年 1 月起披露其加密资产风险敞口的模板。【原文：Global banking regulators have approved templates for banks to disclose their exposure to crypto assets from January 2026, they said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国发现 590 万辆汽车排放超标，通用汽车将支付 1.458 亿美元罚款
item.description: 消息人士告诉路透社，在政府调查发现约 590 万辆通用汽车排放超标后，通用汽车公司将支付 1.458 亿美元的罚款。【原文：General Motors will pay a $145.8 million penalty after a government investigation found excess emissions from approximately 5.9 million GM vehicles, sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 菲斯科寻求法官批准以每辆 1.4 万美元的价格销售遨享电动汽车
item.description: 菲斯科已请求负责监督其破产保护程序的破产法官批准将其库存的 3000 多辆 Ocean 电动 SUV 以每辆约 1.4 万美元的价格出售给一家汽车租赁公司。【原文：Fisker has asked a bankruptcy judge overseeing its Chapter 11 proceedings to approve the sale of more than 3,000 Ocean electric SUVs in its inventory for about $14,000 per car to a vehicle-leasing company.】

item.title: 美国 5 月份工厂订单意外下降
item.description: 美国政府周三公布的数据显示，5 月份美国制成品的新订单出人意料地减少，而企业的设备支出似乎也比最初想象的要弱。【原文：New orders for U.S.-manufactured goods unexpectedly fell in May, while business spending on equipment appeared weaker than initially thought, government data showed on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西农业部长称进口大米的行动 "没有必要
item.description: 巴西农业部长卡洛斯-法瓦罗（Carlos Favaro）周三告诉当地一家电视频道，巴西政府将不再需要购买进口大米，此前该计划遭到了当地农民的抨击。【原文：The Brazilian government will no longer need to buy imported rice, Agriculture Minister Carlos Favaro told a local TV channel on Wednesday, after the plan attracted flak from local farmers.】

item.title: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 与法国原子能委员会合作开展电动汽车电池研究
item.description: Stellantis 是一家汽车制造商，旗下品牌包括标致、菲亚特和克莱斯勒，该公司周三宣布与法国国家原子能委员会（CEA）研究机构合作，共同开发下一代电动汽车电池。【原文：Stellantis , the carmaker whose brands include Peugeot, Fiat and Chrysler, announced on Wednesday a partnership with the French state's CEA research organisation to work on a next generation of battery cells for electric vehicles.】

item.title: 美国 6 月服务业订单下滑
item.description: 由于订单急剧下降，衡量美国服务业活动的一项指标在 6 月份跌至四年来的最低点，这可能暗示着经济在第二季度末将失去动力。【原文：A measure of U.S. services sector activity slumped to a four-year low in June amid a sharp drop in orders, potentially hinting at a loss of momentum in the economy at the end of the second quarter.】

item.title: 福特汽车第二季度销量放缓，CDK 网络攻击令业界震惊
item.description: 福特汽车周三公布的第二季度销售额增长放缓了约 1%，美国汽车行业正受到 CDK 网络攻击的影响。【原文：Ford on Wednesday reported a slower rise of about 1% in second-quarter sales, as the U.S. auto industry reels from the effects of the CDK cyberattack.】

item.title: 出口疲软导致美国 5 月贸易逆差扩大
item.description: 在出口下降的情况下，美国 5 月份的贸易赤字连续第二个月扩大，这表明贸易很可能在第二季度继续拖累经济增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened for a second straight month in May amid a decline in exports, indicating that trade likely remained a drag on economic growth in the second quarter.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数上升 劳动力市场放缓
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济的美国人数有所增加，表明劳动力市场状况有所缓解。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased last week, pointing to easing labor market conditions.】

item.title: 巴西 5 月工业产值降幅低于预期
item.description: 政府统计机构巴西地理统计局（IBGE）周三称，巴西 5 月份的工业生产比 4 月份下降了 0.9%，低于路透社调查的分析师估计的 1.7% 的降幅。【原文：Industrial production in Brazil fell 0.9% in May from April , government statistics agency IBGE said on Wednesday, below the 1.7% decline estimated by analysts polled by Reuters.】

item.title: 欧盟报告详述中国对经济的广泛干预
item.description: 在宣布对中国制造的电动汽车征收临时关税之前，欧盟委员会于 4 月发布了一份长达 712 页的报告，报告称中国政府向国内企业提供了多层补贴。【原文：In the run up to announcing provisional tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles, the European Commission in April released a 712-page report on the many layers of subsidies it argues the Chinese government provides to domestic firms.】

item.title: 美国 6 月私营部门就业人数增长放缓
item.description: 美国 6 月份私营企业薪资增幅略低于预期，与劳动力市场放缓的势头一致。【原文：U.S. private payrolls increased a bit less than expected in June, consistent with slowing labor market momentum.】

item.title: 星座品牌啤酒业务强劲，季度利润超预期
item.description: 科罗娜啤酒制造商星座品牌公司（Constellation Brands）周三公布的第一季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其核心啤酒品牌的强劲需求抵消了葡萄酒和烈酒业务的低迷。【原文：Corona beer maker Constellation Brands on Wednesday beat Wall Street estimates for first-quarter profit, helped by strong demand for its core beer brands, which offset the sluggish wines and spirits business.】

item.title: 2001 年以来航空公司并购的发展轨迹
item.description: 欧盟委员会周三批准了一项期待已久的交易，汉莎航空将获得意大利 ITA 航空公司 41% 的股份，这是欧洲最新的一次重大合并。【原文：The European Commission approved a long-awaited deal for Lufthansa to take a 41% stake in Italy's ITA Airways on Wednesday, in Europe's latest major consolidation.】

item.title: 拜登和特朗普争夺总统宝座之际值得关注的股票
item.description: 在第一场美国总统辩论中，乔-拜登总统的表现不尽如人意，尤其是在辩论开始时，他与前总统特朗普就堕胎、移民、乌克兰和加沙战争，甚至两人的高尔夫球比赛等问题进行了激烈交锋。【原文：The first U.S. presidential debate saw President Joe Biden turning in a fitful performance, especially at the beginning, as he exchanged barbs with former President Trump on abortion, immigration, the wars in Ukraine and Gaza and even their golf games.】

item.title: 美联储威廉姆斯怀疑中性利率已经上升
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周三表示，对经济影响中性的利率水平可能还没有上升太多。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said on Wednesday that the level of interest rates that’s neutral in its impact on the economy likely hasn’t risen much.】

item.title: 监管文件显示，Artisan Investments 将所持飞利浦股份增至 10
item.description: 美国资产管理公司 Artisan Investments 已将其在飞利浦公司的持股比例提高到 10%，这使得这家医疗保健技术集团的股价在周三上涨，一周前这家荷兰公司的最大股东也增持了飞利浦公司的股份。【原文：U.S. asset management firm Artisan Investments has raised its stake in Philips to 10%, sending the healthcare technology group's shares rising on Wednesday, a week after the Dutch company's biggest shareholder also increased its holding.】

item.title: 埃利奥特推动改革后，西南航空采用毒丸计划
item.description: 美国西南航空公司周三表示，在激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）推动该公司进行改革后，该公司已采取了毒丸措施。【原文：Southwest Airlines said on Wednesday it had adopted a poison pill after activist investor Elliott Investment Management pushed for changes at the carrier.】

item.title: 普华永道在监管审查中任命新中国区主管
item.description: 普华永道（PwC）已任命内部高管丹尼尔-李（Daniel Li）为其新任中国区主管，此举正值该公司面临中国大陆和香港金融监管机构的调查之际。【原文：PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) has named in-house executive Daniel Li as its new China head, a move that comes as it faces investigations by financial regulators in mainland China and Hong Kong.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）结束对大众约42万辆汽车的召回查询
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）周三结束了对大众汽车公司的召回查询，在此之前，该公司已对 420,072 辆汽车进行了修复，以补救潜在的燃油泄漏问题。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) on Wednesday closed a recall query on Volkswagen for 420,072 vehicles after they were fixed to remedy a potential fuel leak.】
